    public static class Node.NodeBuilder0
extends Object
    A factory for nodes with zero or more inputs.

    • Method Detail

      • define

        public <T> Node<T> define(Callable<T> op)
        Defines the node's operation and returns the newly constructed node. The given operation accepts no arguments and returns the node's result.
        Parameters:
        op - the node's operation
        Returns:
        the newly constructed node

      • defineAsync

        public <T> Node<T> defineAsync(Callable<ListenableFuture<T>> op)
        Defines the node's operation and returns the newly constructed node. The given operation accepts no arguments and returns an asynchronous (e.g. future) result.
        Parameters:
        op - the node's operation
        Returns:
        the newly constructed node

      • withInput

        public <T> Node.NodeBuilder1<T> withInput(Class<T> input)
        Adds the first input to this node. The input is a required, synchronous input of the given type and is bound to a value when the graph is executed.

        The input is associated with an unqualified input key. This is the same as the following:
        builder.withInput(Key.of(input));

        Parameters:
        input - the type of the input
        Returns:
        a node builder that can be used to add additional inputs or define the node's operation

      • withInput

        public <T> Node.NodeBuilder1<T> withInput(TypeRef<T> input)
        Adds the first input to this node. The input is a required, synchronous input of the given type and is bound to a value when the graph is executed.

        The input is associated with an unqualified input key. This is the same as the following:
        builder.withInput(Key.of(input));

        Parameters:
        input - the type of the input
        Returns:
        a node builder that can be used to add additional inputs or define the node's operation

      • withInput

        public <T> Node.NodeBuilder1<T> withInput(Key<T> input)
        Adds the first input to this node. The input is a required, synchronous input with the given input key and is bound to a value when the graph is executed.
        Parameters:
        input - the key for the input
        Returns:
        a node builder that can be used to add additional inputs or define the node's operation

      • dependingOn

        public <T> Node.NodeBuilder1<T> dependingOn(Node<T> input)
        Adds the first input to this node. The input is required and synchronous. Its value is bound to the result of the given node when the graph is executed.
        Parameters:
        input - the node that provides the input
        Returns:
        a node builder that can be used to add additional inputs or define the node's operation
